key_findings.arguments_validity: Mathematically sound under standard QM assumptions
gaps: Lack of rigorous topological definition for 'continuous phase'
Incomplete analysis of non-standard tensor products for ℍ
recommendations: Add K_observables (Hermitian structure) as supporting principle
Explore category theory for formalizing Layer 2→3

argument_refinements: ℝ: Emphasize discrete (not absent) relative phase
ℍ: Standard tensor product problematic, Adler requires extra structure
key_findings.independence_assessment: Principles likely related to 'information preservation' but not trivially reducible
key_findings.empirical_classification: Correct - these are empirical inputs, unlikely derivable from Layer 2
key_findings.forcing_strength: Medium-to-strong (simplest and most natural given physics)
key_findings.category_theory_recommendation: Use functors to formalize decoherence mechanism

unanimous_findings: Arguments mathematically sound under standard assumptions
ℂ is unique given observed physical principles
Empirical classification correct (Layer 2→3 requires physics input)
Category theory needed for rigorous decoherence formalization

overall_assessment.core_result: ℂ uniquely necessary given K_physics (interference, compositionality, time)
